channel.title: CVE Feed for Nvidia Corporation -- GPU Display Driver
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Nvidia Corporation -- GPU Display Driver

item.title: CVE-2017-0345|2024-08-05T13:03:56.919Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgDdiEscape where user provided input used as an array size is not correctly validated allows out of bound access in kernel memory and may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges

item.title: CVE-2017-0346|2024-08-05T13:03:56.603Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where the size of an input buffer is not validated, leading to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0354|2024-08-05T13:03:56.540Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a call to certain function requiring lower IRQL can be made under raised IRQL which may lead to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-0309|2024-08-05T13:03:56.529Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where multiple integer overflows may cause improper memory allocation leading to a denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0352|2024-08-05T13:03:56.684Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the GPU firmware where incorrect access control may allow CPU access sensitive GPU control registers, leading to an escalation of privileges

item.title: CVE-2017-0323|2024-08-05T13:03:56.629Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where a NULL pointer dereference caused by invalid user input may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0342|2024-08-05T13:03:56.544Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler where incorrect calculation may cause an invalid address access leading to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0310|2024-08-05T13:03:56.436Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where improper access controls allowing unprivileged user to cause a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-0351|2024-08-05T13:03:56.537Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where a NULL pointer dereference caused by invalid user input may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-6247|2024-08-05T06:01:48.297Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a NULL pointer dereference may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-6252|2024-08-05T06:01:48.554Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgkDdiEscape where the software allows an actor access to restricted functionality that is unnecessary to production usage, and which may result in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-0321|2024-08-05T13:03:56.399Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where a NULL pointer dereference caused by invalid user input may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0311|2024-08-05T13:03:56.550Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver R378 contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where improper access control may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-6250|2024-08-05T06:01:47.683Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a NULL pointer dereference occurs which may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0347|2024-08-05T13:03:56.620Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a value passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated and used as the index to an array, which may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0344|2024-08-05T13:03:56.957Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgDdiEscape may allow users to gain access to arbitrary physical memory, leading to escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0350|2024-08-05T13:03:56.538Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where a value passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated and used in an offset calculation may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0349|2024-08-05T13:03:56.797Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape where a pointer passed from a user to the driver is not correctly validated before it is dereferenced for a write operation, may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0341|2024-08-05T13:03:56.953Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgDdiEscape where user provided input can trigger an access to a pointer that has not been initialized which may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0348|2024-08-05T13:03:56.672Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler where a NULL pointer dereference may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2018-6251|2024-08-05T06:01:48.666Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the DirectX 10 Usermode driver, where a specially crafted pixel shader can cause writing to unallocated memory, leading to denial of service or potential code execution.

item.title: CVE-2017-0353|2024-08-05T13:03:56.820Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgDdiEscape where due to improper locking on certain conditions may lead to a denial of service

item.title: CVE-2018-6253|2024-08-05T06:01:47.995Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the DirectX and OpenGL Usermode drivers where a specially crafted pixel shader can cause infinite recursion leading to denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-6248|2024-08-05T06:01:48.291Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgkDdiEscape where the software uses a sequential operation to read or write a buffer, but it uses an incorrect length value that causes it to access memory that is outside of the bounds of the buffer which may lead to denial of service or possible escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0355|2024-08-05T13:03:56.567Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler for DxgkDdiEscape where it may access paged memory while holding a spinlock, leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2018-6249|2024-08-05T06:01:47.664Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in kernel mode layer handler where a NULL pointer dereference may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

item.title: CVE-2017-0343|2024-08-05T13:03:56.545Z -- nvidia%20corporation -- gpu%20display%20driver
item.description: All versions of the NVIDIA Windows GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) where user can trigger a race condition due to lack of synchronization in two functions leading to a denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.
